1.) Column is a layout composable that places its children in a vertical sequence.
2.) Padding order determines whether it\'s padding or margin for that component. In example below check out paddings.
3.) Shadow can be applied to Column or Row.
1.) Box aligns children on top of each other like a Stack. The one declared last is on top.
2.) Elements in Box can be aligned with different alignments.
3.) Spacer can be used to align elements to end or bottom of screen.
4.) Weight determines, based on total weight, how much of the parent\'s dimensions should be occupied by each child. \nSpacer is used to create horizontal or vertical space between components.
Row is a layout composable that places its children in a horizontal sequence.
1.) Adding clickable to Modifier makes a component clickable.\nPadding before clickable makes clickable area smaller than component\'s total area.
1.) Surface can set content color for Text and Image.
2.) Surface can clips it\'s children to selected shape.
3.) Surface can set Z index and border of it\'s children.
4.) Components can have offset in both x and y axes. Surface inside another surface gets clipped when it overflows from it\'s parent.
